result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J. Schaefer Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick J. Schaefer Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patrick J. Schaefer Jr was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Patrick J. Schaefer Jr was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
02:59 PM Defendant Patrick J. Schaefer in court with attorney Blake Duren.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Duren received the revocation packet.  Atty Juech received the revocation packet.    State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Duren makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 8 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber on each count; concurrent
Report immediately
Credit = 141 days
Any unpaid fines to be converted to a civil judgment
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 20, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Patrick J. Schaefer in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM18, 15CT48, 16CM23, 16CT35, 15TR161, 15TR162, 15TR163 & 15TR169 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 3 in 16CM23, Ct. 2 in 16CT35 and Ct. 1 in 15TR161.  
15CT48, Counts 2 & 4 in 16CM23, Counts 1 & 3 in 16CT35, 15TR162, 15TR163 & 15TR169 to be dismissed.
Atty Johnson agrees and enters a No Contest plea.  Defendant agrees.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 3 in 16CM23, Ct. 2 in 16CT35 and Ct. 1 in 15TR161.  
15CT48, Counts 2 & 4 in 16CM23, Counts 1 & 3 in 16CT35, 15TR162, 15TR163 & 15TR169 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee states that 15CM18 is an open case that the State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Also there is Restitution requested in that matter. 
Atty Johnson asks that the surcharge be waived.
Atty Johnson states that there is another charge that the State is agreeing to not charge.  Atty Hendee agrees and states the case number is 15-SO3951.

BY THE COURT:  16CM23 - Counts 1 & 3:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
DNA Sample + $200 Surcharge on each count
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the agent
Restitution ordered in the amount of $1,243.83
Counts 2 & 4 to be dismissed.

16CT35 - Count 2:  Court orders 90 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence:
  Report on or before November 4, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May travel outside the county for huber
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $200.00 Surcharge
Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed.

15TR161:  Pay fine and costs = $874.50
9 months DL revocation and Ignition Interlock
AODA and any follow-up treatment

15CT48 to be dismissed.
15TR162 to be dismissed.
15TR163 to be dismissed.
15TR169 to be dismissed.
15CM18 to be dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Patrick J. Schaefer in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CT48, 16CM23, 16CT35 along with traffic matters tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that there is resolution but asks for a reset of the Plea/Sentencing.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM23, 16CT35, 15CT48, 15CM18 & 15TR161 tracking together:
Atty Johnson asks that all the matters track together.
BY THE COURT:  All cases above will track.

Atty Johnson asks for a plea/sentencing date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for plea/sentencing.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
CASES TRACKING:
15CM18, 15CT48, 15TR161, 15TR162, 15TR163, 15TR169, 16CM23 & 16CT35
Attorney did request for 12-Person Jury Trial and PTC in 05-09-16 Correspondence.
Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions
Letter dated 05-09-16 from Atty Erk C. Johnson notifying of representation and entering NG Plea w/encs.
Return date on June 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick J. Schaefer in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CT35 & 16CM23 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that there was a warrant issued on April 11th for 16CT35 and feels that this case should be called along with 15CT48 and 16CM18.
BY THE COURT:  16CT35; warrant satisfied based on defendant's appearance today.
  Atty Johnson states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaints in 16CT35 & 16CM23 & waives their reading.   Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Atty Johnson states that he has not been appointed on 16CT35 yet.  Defendant asks that Atty Johnson be appointed.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Atty Johnson will be appointed on 16CT35 also.
  Return date scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on April 25, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Patrick J. Schaefer by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions defendant on his failure to appear.  Defendant states he didn't get anything that told him he needed to be here.  Court questions defendant further.  Atty Hendee requests cash bond.  Defendant states he has always appeared for court.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $250.00 cash bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court will appoint Atty Erik Johnson in this matter as he has been appointed on defendant's other cases.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Patrick J. Schaefer not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that a summons was sent with the criminal complaint.    Atty Hendee states that the defendant has two open cases at this time and has Atty Johnson on those cases.  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue; stayed for 48 hours to give the defendant time to contact the court.
